instances.title: Number of Postgres instances in the cluster

logLevel.title: The instances log level, one of the following values: error, warning, info (default), debug, trace

image.title: Docker image for the PG instances

nameOverride.title: String to partially override cnpg-cluster.fullname template with a string (will prepend the release name)

fullnameOverride.title: String to fully override cnpg-cluster.fullname template with a string

resources.title: CPU/Memory resource requests/limits
resources.description:
We usually recommend not to specify default resources and to leave this as a conscious
choice for the user. This also increases chances charts run on environments with little
resources, such as Minikube. If you do want to specify resources, uncomment the following
lines, adjust them as necessary, and remove the curly braces after 'resources:'.

nodeSelector.title: Postgres instances labels for pod assignment

priorityClassName.title: Name of the priority class which will be used in every generated Pod
priorityClassName.description: Name of the priority class which will be used in every generated Pod, if the PriorityClass specified does not exist, the pod will not be able to schedule. Please refer to https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/pod-priority-preemption/#priorityclass for more information

tolerations.title: Postgres instances labels for tolerations pod assignment

extraAffinity.title: Extra configuration for Cluster's affinity resource, see: https://cloudnative-pg.io/documentation/1.17/api_reference/#AffinityConfiguration

size.title: Size of each instance storage volume

resizeInUseVolumes.title: Resize existent PVCs, defaults to true

storageClass.title: StorageClass to use for database data,
storageClass.description:
Applied after evaluating the PVC template, if available.
If not specified, generated PVCs will be satisfied by the default storage class

pvcTemplate.title: Template to be used to generate the Persistent Volume Claim

schedule.title: Schedule the backups, for instance every day at midnight
schedule.description: this cron format has the seconds on the left

sqlDumpSchedule.title: Schedule the SQL dump backups, for instance every day at midnight

retentionPolicy.title: RetentionPolicy is the retention policy to be used for backups and WALs (i.e. '60d').
retentionPolicy.description:
The retention policy is expressed in the form of XXu where XX is a positive integer and
u is in [dwm] - days, weeks, months.

sqlDumpRetentionDays.title: Retention period in days for SQL dumps

immediate.title: If the first backup has to be immediately start after creation or not

barmanObjectStore.title: Object store credentials and access config

clusterExtraSpec.title: Extra configuration for Cluster resource. See: https://cloudnative-pg.io/documentation/1.17/api_reference/#clusterspec

scheduledBackups.title: ScheduledBackup resources to create for this Cluster resource. See: https://cloudnative-pg.io/documentation/1.17/api_reference/#ScheduledBackupSpec

poolers.title: Pooler resources to create for this Cluster resource. See: https://cloudnative-pg.io/documentation/1.17/api_reference/#PoolerSpec

externalClusters.title: define external clusters for recovery/replication see https://cloudnative-pg.io/documentation/current/api_reference/#externalcluster

source.title: externalCluster cluster name for the pg_basebackup

dbName.title: Name of the default database to create

dbOwner.title: Name of the default user to create

superuserSecretName.title: To force the super user secret name

dbSecretName.title: To force the DB secret name

targetTime.title: Time to restore from, in RFC3339 format https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339

secretName.title: Secret where owner password is set

barmanObjectStore.title: Object store credentials and access config

postInitApplicationSQL.title: List of SQL queries to be executed as a superuser in the application database right after is created - to be used with extreme care (by default empty)

postInitApplicationSQLRefs.description:
Points references to ConfigMaps or Secrets which contain SQL files, the general implementation order to these references is from all Secrets to all ConfigMaps, and inside Secrets or ConfigMaps, the implementation order is same as the order of each array (by default empty
See https://cloudnative-pg.io/documentation/current/api_reference/#postinitapplicationsqlrefs
